Parameters

  • os_username (str) – Administrator username for the source Windows operating system.

  • os_password (str) – Administrator user password for the source Windows operating system.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.History(defer_import=None, data_set=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Configuration of the data to be exported during upgrade/migrate.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • defer_import (bool or None) – A flag to indicate whether the import of historical data should be deferred until after upgrade/migrate. If None, defaults to False

  • data_set (History.DataSetType or None) – The type of data to be upgraded/migrated. If None, defaults to ALL

class DataSetType(string)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.enum.Enum

The type of data to be upgraded/migrated.

Note

This class represents an enumerated type in the interface language definition. The class contains class attributes which represent the values in the current version of the enumerated type. Newer versions of the enumerated type may contain new values. To use new values of the enumerated type in communication with a server that supports the newer version of the API, you instantiate this class. See enumerated type description page.

Parameters

string (str) – String value for the DataSetType instance.

ALL = DataSetType(string='ALL')¶

core, event and task data.

EVENTS_TASKS = DataSetType(string='EVENTS_TASKS')¶

event data and task data.

NONE = DataSetType(string='NONE')¶

core only.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.Install(config)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.stub.VapiInterface

The service to install Embedded VCSA, PSC, Management VCSA, VMC gateway.

Parameters

config (vmware.vapi.bindings.stub.StubConfiguration) – Configuration to be used for creating the stub.

class DestinationAppliance(appliance_name=None, appliance_type=None, appliance_size=None, appliance_disk_size=None, root_password=None, thin_disk_mode=None, ova_location=None, ova_location_ssl_verify=None, ova_location_ssl_thumbprint=None, ovftool_location=None, ovftool_location_ssl_verify=None, ovftool_location_ssl_thumbprint=None, services=None, network=None, time=None, ovftool_arguments=None, vcsa_embedded=None, psc=None, vcsa_external=None, vmc=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Spec to describe the new appliance.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • appliance_name (str) – The name of the appliance to deploy.

  • appliance_type (ApplianceType) – The type of appliance to deploy.

  • appliance_size (ApplianceSize or None) – A size descriptor based on the number of virtual machines which will be managed by the new vCenter appliance. If None, defaults to SMALL

  • appliance_disk_size (StorageSize or None) – The disk size of the new vCenter appliance. If None, defaults to REGULAR

  • root_password (str) – Password must conform to the following requirements: 1. At least 8 characters. 2. No more than 20 characters. 3. At least 1 uppercase character. 4. At least 1 lowercase character. 5. At least 1 number. 6. At least 1 special character (e.g., ‘!’, ‘(‘, ‘\@’, etc.). 7. Only visible A-Z, a-z, 0-9 and punctuation (spaces are not allowed)

  • thin_disk_mode (bool) – Whether to deploy the appliance with thin mode virtual disks.

  • ova_location (str) – The location of the OVA file.

  • ova_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – A flag to indicate whether the ssl verification is required. If ovaLocationSslThumbprint is provided, this field can be omitted If None, defaults to True

  • ova_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of ssl verification. If provided, ssl_verify can be omitted or set to true. If omitted, ssl_verify must be false. If omitted and ssl_verify is true, an error will occur. If ova_location_ssl_verify is False, this field can be omitted

  • ovftool_location (str) – The location of the OVF Tool.

  • ovftool_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – Flag to indicate whether or not to verify the SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location. if None, Default to be True.

  • ovftool_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location to be verified. When ovftoolLocationSslVerify is set to False, this field can be omitted.

  • services (Install.DestinationApplianceService) – The configuration of vCenter services.

  • network (Network) – The network settings of the appliance to be deployed.

  • time (Time) – Configuration of the vCSA time synchronization.

  • ovftool_arguments ((dict of str and str) or None) – The OVF Tool arguments to be included. Not required when no OVF Tool argument to pass through

  • vcsa_embedded (Install.VcsaEmbedded) – Spec used to configure an embedded vCenter Server. This field describes how the embedded vCenter Server appliance should be configured. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of applianceType is ApplianceType.VCSA_EMBEDDED.

  • psc (Install.Psc) – Spec used to configure a Platform Services Controller. This section describes how the Platform Services Controller appliance should be configured. If unset, either vcsaEmbedded or vcsaExternal must be provided. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of applianceType is ApplianceType.PSC.

  • vcsa_external (ExternalVcsa) – Spec used to configure a vCenter Server registered with an external PSC. If unset, either vcsa_embedded or psc must be provided. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of applianceType is ApplianceType.VCSA_EXTERNAL.

  • vmc (ExternalVcsa) – Spec used to configure a vCenter Server registered with an external PSC. If unset, either vcsa_embedded or psc must be provided. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of applianceType is ApplianceType.VMC.

class DestinationApplianceService(rhttpproxy=None, ssh=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

The configuration of vCenter services.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • rhttpproxy (Install.ReverseProxy or None) – Port numbers on which the vCenter Server Appliance communicates with the other vSphere components. Default value used reverse proxy not provided

  • ssh (Ssh) – Whether to enable SSH on the vCenter Appliance.

class Psc(standalone=None, replicated=None, ceip_enabled=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Spec used to configure a Platform Services Controller. This section describes how the Platform Services Controller appliance should be configured. If unset, either #vcsaEmbedded or #vcsaExternal must be provided.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • standalone (PscStandalone or None) – Spec used to configure a standalone Platform Services Controller. This section describes how the standalone PSC should be configured. Mutually exclusive between standalone and replicated

  • replicated (PscReplicated or None) – Spec used to configure a replicated Platform Services Controller. This section describes how the replicated PSC should be configured. Mutually exclusive between standalone and replicated

  • ceip_enabled (bool) – This key describes the enabling option for the VMware’s Customer Experience Improvement Program (CEIP). By default we have ceipEnabled: true, which indicates that you are joining CEIP. If you prefer not to participate in the VMware’s CEIP for this product, you must disable CEIP by setting ceipEnabled: false. You may join or leave VMware’s CEIP for this product at any time.

class ReverseProxy(http_port=None, https_port=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Port numbers on which the vCenter Server Appliance communicates with the other vSphere components.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • http_port (long or None) – Reverse proxy http port. If None, defaults to 8080

  • https_port (long or None) – Reverse proxy https port. If None, defaults to 8443

class Spec(destination_location=None, destination_appliance=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • destination_location (DestinationLocation) – This subsection describes the ESX or VC on which to deploy the appliance.

  • destination_appliance (Install.DestinationAppliance) – Spec to describe the new appliance.

class VcsaEmbedded(standalone=None, replicated=None, ceip_enabled=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Spec used to configure an embedded vCenter Server. This field describes how the embedded vCenter Server appliance should be configured.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • standalone (EmbeddedStandaloneVcsa or None) – Spec used to configure a standalone embedded vCenter Server. This field describes how the standalone vCenter Server appliance should be configured. Mutually exclusive between standalone and replicated

  • replicated (EmbeddedReplicatedVcsa or None) – Spec used to configure a replicated embedded vCenter Server. This field describes how the replicated vCenter Server appliance should be configured. Mutually exclusive between standalone and replicated

  • ceip_enabled (bool) – This key describes the enabling option for the VMware’s Customer Experience Improvement Program (CEIP). By default we have ceipEnabled: true, which indicates that you are joining CEIP. If you prefer not to participate in the VMware’s CEIP for this product, you must disable CEIP by setting ceipEnabled: false. You may join or leave VMware’s CEIP for this product at any time.

check_task(spec, options=None)¶

Performs a precheck for the given specification. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} with the task-id in the response of this call.

Parameters

  • spec (Install.Spec) – The specification of the deployment.

  • options (DeploymentOption or None) – The deployment precheck options.

Raise

com.vmware.vapi.std.errors_client.InvalidArgument If the given spec and/or option contains error.

start_task(spec)¶

Deploys the appliance for the given specification. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} with the task-id in the response of this call.

Parameters

spec (Install.Spec) – The specification of the deployment.

Raise

com.vmware.vapi.std.errors_client.InvalidArgument If the given specification contains error.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.Log(config)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.stub.VapiInterface

The service that provides logs associated with a task of a given task ID.

Parameters

config (vmware.vapi.bindings.stub.StubConfiguration) – Configuration to be used for creating the stub.

get(task_id)¶

Retrieves the zipped files that contains operation log, serialized task flow, record of all configuration, and a current status of the operation.

Parameters

task_id (str) – The vmodl.lang_client.ID of the operation. must exist in the server. If for any reason the server reboots during an operation, all vmodl.lang_client.ID`s previously stored is lost. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ``com.vmware.cis.task`.

Return type

str

Returns

A zipped file that contains the files mentioned above.

Raise

com.vmware.vapi.std.errors_client.InvalidArgument If the given ID does not exist in the server. There might be a cause of task ID does not exist including, error in taskID, or log files been purged by system or manually.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.Migrate(config)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.stub.VapiInterface

The service to migrate a windows VC to Embedded VCSA, PSC, and Management VCSA.

Parameters

config (vmware.vapi.bindings.stub.StubConfiguration) – Configuration to be used for creating the stub.

class MigrateDestinationAppliance(appliance_name=None, appliance_type=None, appliance_size=None, appliance_disk_size=None, root_password=None, thin_disk_mode=None, ova_location=None, ova_location_ssl_verify=None, ova_location_ssl_thumbprint=None, ovftool_location=None, ovftool_location_ssl_verify=None, ovftool_location_ssl_thumbprint=None, active_directory_domain=None, active_directory_username=None, active_directory_password=None, services=None, temporary_network=None, history=None, ovftool_arguments=None, vcsa_embedded=None, psc=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Spec to describe the new appliance.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • appliance_name (str) – The name of the appliance to deploy.

  • appliance_type (ApplianceType or None) – The type of appliance to deploy. If None, defaults to VCSA_EMBEDDED

  • appliance_size (ApplianceSize or None) – A size descriptor based on the number of virtual machines which will be managed by the new vCenter appliance. If None, defaults to SMALL

  • appliance_disk_size (StorageSize or None) – The disk size of the new vCenter appliance. If None, defaults to REGULAR

  • root_password (str) – Password must conform to the following requirements: 1. At least 8 characters. 2. No more than 20 characters. 3. At least 1 uppercase character. 4. At least 1 lowercase character. 5. At least 1 number. 6. At least 1 special character (e.g., ‘!’, ‘(‘, ‘\@’, etc.). 7. Only visible A-Z, a-z, 0-9 and punctuation (spaces are not allowed)

  • thin_disk_mode (bool) – Whether to deploy the appliance with thin mode virtual disks.

  • ova_location (str) – The location of the OVA file.

  • ova_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – A flag to indicate whether the ssl verification is required. If ovaLocationSslThumbprint is provided, this field can be omitted If None, defaults to True

  • ova_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of ssl verification. If provided, ssl_verify can be omitted or set to true. If omitted, ssl_verify must be false. If omitted and ssl_verify is true, an error will occur. If ova_location_ssl_verify is False, this field can be omitted

  • ovftool_location (str) – The location of the OVF Tool.

  • ovftool_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – Flag to indicate whether or not to verify the SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location. if None, Default to be True.

  • ovftool_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location to be verified. When ovftoolLocationSslVerify is set to False, this field can be omitted.

  • active_directory_domain (str or None) – The name of the Active Directory domain to which the source Windows installation is joined. If the source Windows installation is not joined to an Active Directory domain, omit this parameter. Not required when active directory is not applicable

  • active_directory_username (str or None) – Administrator user name of the Active Directory domain to which the source Windows installation is joined. The format can be either ‘username’ or ‘username\@domain’ Not required when active directory is not applicable

  • active_directory_password (str or None) – Password for the active directory user. Not required when active directory is not applicable

  • services (UpgradeDestinationApplianceService) – Spec to configure vCenter server services.

  • temporary_network (TemporaryNetwork) – The network settings of the appliance to be deployed.

  • history (History or None) – History data to be included in the upgrade and migrate Default value will be applied when absent

  • ovftool_arguments ((dict of str and str) or None) – The OVF Tool arguments to be included. Not required when no OVF Tool argument to pass through

  • vcsa_embedded (CeipOnlySso) – Spec used to configure an embedded vCenter Server. This field describes how the embedded vCenter Server appliance should be configured. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of applianceType is ApplianceType.VCSA_EMBEDDED.

  • psc (CeipOnlySso) – Spec used to configure a Platform Services Controller. This section describes how the Platform Services Controller appliance should be configured. If unset, either vcsaEmbedded or #vcsaExternal must be provided. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of applianceType is ApplianceType.PSC.

class Spec(destination_location=None, destination_appliance=None, source_vc_windows=None, existing_migration_assistant=None, start_migration_assistant=None, source_vum_location=None, source_vum=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Spec to describe the configuration parameters that are required for migrating a Windows vCenter Server.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • destination_location (DestinationLocation) – This subsection describes the ESX or VC on which to deploy the appliance.

  • destination_appliance (Migrate.MigrateDestinationAppliance) – Spec to describe the new appliance.

  • source_vc_windows (SourceVcWindows) – Spec to describe the existing Windows vCenter server to migrate.

  • existing_migration_assistant (ExistingMigrationAssistant or None) – Spec to describe the attributes of a running Migration Assistant on the Windows vCenter server. Only applicable when migration assistant is already running on the source appliance

  • start_migration_assistant (MigrationAssistant or None) – Spec to automate the invocation of Migration Assistant. Automatic invocation works only if the source Windows installation is running as a virtual machine. Only applicable when migration assistant is not running on the source appliance.

  • source_vum_location (Connection or None) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

  • source_vum (SourceVum or None) – This section describes the source vSphere Update Manager (VUM) which you want to upgrade. Not applicable for appliance not having source vSphere Update Manager

check_task(spec, options=None)¶

Performs a precheck for the given specification. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} with the task-id in the response of this call.

Parameters

  • spec (Migrate.Spec) – The specification of the deployment.

  • options (DeploymentOption or None) – The deployment precheck options.

Raise

com.vmware.vapi.std.errors_client.InvalidArgument If the given spec and/or option contains error.

start_task(spec)¶

Deploys the appliance for the given specification. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} with the task-id in the response of this call.

Parameters

spec (Migrate.Spec) – The specification of the deployment.

Raise

com.vmware.vapi.std.errors_client.InvalidArgument If the given specification contains error.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.MigrationAssistant(source_location=None, settings=None, guest_credentials=None, migration_assistant_installer_location=None, migration_assistant_installer_location_ssl_verify=None, migration_assistant_installer_location_ssl_thumbprint=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Configuration of the migration assistant to be uploaded and started on source Windows VC.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • source_location (Connection) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

  • settings (MigrationAssistantSetting) – Spec to automatically launch the Migration Assistant.

  • guest_credentials (GuestCredential) – Credentials for the Windows system on which the vCenter server is running.

  • migration_assistant_installer_location (str or None) – Installer location of the migration assistant to be uploaded.

  • migration_assistant_installer_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – A flag to indicate whether to verify ssl connection. when SSL thumbprint is provided, SSL verify is not required.

  • migration_assistant_installer_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of the source appliance. if ssl verify is set to False, thumbprint is not required.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.MigrationAssistantSetting(migrated_ip=None, https_port=None, export_dir=None, service_account_password=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Configuration of the setting of migration assistant to be uploaded and started on source Windows VC.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • migrated_ip (str or None) – The IP address of the network adapter that will be migrated. Only required if the Windows vCenter Server has multiple network adapters, making its system name resolve to multiple IP addresses. May not be applicable.

  • https_port (long or None) – Migration Assistant port number shown in the Migration Assistant console. The default port is 9123 If None, defaults to 9123

  • export_dir (str or None) – Directory to export source configuration and data. Optional. If None, defaults to /var/tmp

  • service_account_password (str or None) – The password of the vCenter Server service account. Required only if the vCenter Server service is running under a non LocalSystem account. Service account may not be applicable

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.Network(hostname=None, ip_family=None, mode=None, ip=None, dns_servers=None, prefix=None, gateway=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Network configuration of the appliance to be deployed.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • hostname (str or None) – Primary network identity. Can be either an IP address or a fully qualified domain name(FQDN). host name may not be applicable

  • ip_family (TemporaryNetwork.IpType or None) – Network IP address family. If None, defaults to IPV4

  • mode (TemporaryNetwork.NetworkMode) – Network mode.

  • ip (str) – Network IP address. Required for static mode only. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of mode is TemporaryNetwork.NetworkMode.STATIC.

  • dns_servers (list of str) – A comma-separated list of IP addresses of DNS servers. A JSON array such as [“1.2.3.4”, “127.0.0.1”]. Required for static mode only. DNS servers must be reachable from the machine that runs CLI installer This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of mode is TemporaryNetwork.NetworkMode.STATIC.

  • prefix (long) – Network prefix length. Required for static mode only. Remove if the mode is “dhcp”. This is the number of bits set in the subnet mask; for instance, if the subnet mask is 255.255.255.0, there are 24 bits in the binary version of the subnet mask, so the prefix length is 24. If used, the values must be in the inclusive range of 0 to 32 for IPv4 and 0 to 128 for IPv6. Required for static mode only. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of mode is TemporaryNetwork.NetworkMode.STATIC.

  • gateway (str) – Gateway of the network. Required for static mode only. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of mode is TemporaryNetwork.NetworkMode.STATIC.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.Notification(id=None, time=None, message=None, resolution=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Notification messages of a single task.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • id (str) – The identifier of the message.

  • time (datetime.datetime or None) – The time the notification was raised/found. Only set if the time information is available.

  • message (com.vmware.vapi.std_client.LocalizableMessage) – The notification message.

  • resolution (com.vmware.vapi.std_client.LocalizableMessage or None) – The resolution message, if any. Only set for warnings and errors.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.PscReplicated(sso_admin_password=None, sso_domain_name=None, partner_hostname=None, ssl_verify=None, ssl_thumbprint=None, https_port=None, sso_site_name=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Configuration of the replicated Single Sign-On for PSC type deployment.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • sso_admin_password (str) – Administrator password of the PSC to be replicated.

  • sso_domain_name (str) – Domain name of the remote PSC. For example, ‘vsphere.local’

  • partner_hostname (str) – The IP address or DNS resolvable name of the remote PSC.

  • ssl_verify (bool or None) – A flag to indicate whether the SSL verification is required. If sslThumbprint is provided, this field can be omitted If None, defaults to False

  • ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SHA1 thumbprint of the server SSL certificate which will be used for verification. If sslVerify is set to False, this field can be omitted

  • https_port (long or None) – The HTTPS port of the remote PSC. If None, defaults to 443

  • sso_site_name (str or None) – Site name of the newly deployed PSC. Site name may not be applicable

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.PscStandalone(sso_admin_password=None, sso_domain_name=None, sso_site_name=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Configuration of the standalone Single Sign-On for Embedded type deployment.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • sso_admin_password (str) – Password must conform to the following requirements: 1. At least 8 characters. 2. No more than 20 characters. 3. At least 1 uppercase character. 4. At least 1 lowercase character. 5. At least 1 number. 6. At least 1 special character (e.g., ‘!’, ‘(‘, ‘\@’, etc.). 7. Only visible A-Z, a-z, 0-9 and punctuation (spaces are not allowed)

  • sso_domain_name (str) – Domain name of the newly deployed PSC. For example, ‘vsphere.local’

  • sso_site_name (str or None) – Site name of the PSC. Site name may not be applicable

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.Recommendation(config)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.stub.VapiInterface

The service that provide recommendation.

Parameters

config (vmware.vapi.bindings.stub.StubConfiguration) – Configuration to be used for creating the stub.

class DatastoreDestinationAppliance(appliance_size=None, appliance_disk_size=None, ova_location=None, ova_location_ssl_verify=None, ova_location_ssl_thumbprint=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

The configuration of destination appliance to recommend datastore.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • appliance_size (ApplianceSize or None) – A size descriptor based on the number of virtual machines which will be managed by the new vCenter appliance. If None, defaults to SMALL

  • appliance_disk_size (StorageSize or None) – The disk size of the new vCenter appliance. If None, defaults to REGULAR

  • ova_location (str or None) – The location of the ova file. Not required.

  • ova_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – A flag to indicate whether the ssl verification is required. If ovaLocationSslThumbprint is provided, this field can be omitted If None, defaults to True

  • ova_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of ssl verification. If provided, ssl_verify can be omitted or set to true. If omitted, ssl_verify must be false. If omitted and ssl_verify is true, an error will occur. If ova_location_ssl_verify is False, this field can be omitted

class DatastoreDestinationLocation(esx=None, vcenter=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

This subsection describes the ESX or VC on which to deploy the appliance.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • esx (Recommendation.DatastoreEsx or None) – This section describes the ESX host on which to deploy the appliance. Required if you are deploying the appliance directly on an ESX host. Mutual exclusive between esx and vcenter

  • vcenter (Recommendation.DatastoreVc or None) – This subsection describes the vCenter on which to deploy the appliance. Mutual exclusive between esx and vcenter

class DatastoreEsx(connection=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

This section describes the ESX host on which to deploy the appliance. Required if you are deploying the appliance directly on an ESX host.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

connection (Connection) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

class DatastoreInfo(freespace=None, freespace_after_placement=None, required_space=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Datastore space information. Space information are in GB unit.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • freespace (float) – The amount of space that the datastore currently has.

  • freespace_after_placement (float) – The amount of space that the datastore will have after deployment.

  • required_space (float) – The amount of space that the deployment will occupy.

class DatastoreRequest(destination_location=None, destination_appliance=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

The request for recommending datastore.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • destination_location (Recommendation.DatastoreDestinationLocation) – This subsection describes the ESX or VC on which to deploy the appliance.

  • destination_appliance (Recommendation.DatastoreDestinationAppliance) – Spec to describe the new appliance.

class DatastoreVc(connection=None, inventory=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

This subsection describes the vCenter on which to deploy the appliance.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • connection (Connection) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

  • inventory (Recommendation.DatastoreVcInventory) – All names are case-sensitive. you can install the appliance to one of the following destinations: 1. A resource pool in a cluster, use ‘cluster_path’. 2. A specific ESX host in a cluster, use ‘host_path’. 3. A resource pool in a specific ESX host being managed by the current vCenter, use ‘resource_pool_path’. You must always provide the ‘network_name’ key. To install a new appliance to a specific ESX host in a cluster, provide the ‘host_path’ key, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘host_path’: ‘/MyDataCenter/host/MyCluster/10.20.30.40’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To install a new appliance to a specific resource pool, provide the ‘resource_pool_path’, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘resource_pool_path’: ‘/Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster/Resources/Your Resource Pool’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To place a new appliance to a virtual machine Folder, provide the ‘vm_folder_path’, e.g. ‘vm_folder_path’: ‘VM Folder 0/VM Folder1’.

class DatastoreVcInventory(host_path=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

All names are case-sensitive. you can install the appliance to one of the following destinations: 1. A resource pool in a cluster, use ‘cluster_path’. 2. A specific ESX host in a cluster, use ‘host_path’. 3. A resource pool in a specific ESX host being managed by the current vCenter, use ‘resource_pool_path’. You must always provide the ‘network_name’ key. To install a new appliance to a specific ESX host in a cluster, provide the ‘host_path’ key, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘host_path’: ‘/MyDataCenter/host/MyCluster/10.20.30.40’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To install a new appliance to a specific resource pool, provide the ‘resource_pool_path’, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘resource_pool_path’: ‘/Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster/Resources/Your Resource Pool’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To place a new appliance to a virtual machine Folder, provide the ‘vm_folder_path’, e.g. ‘vm_folder_path’: ‘VM Folder 0/VM Folder1’.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

host_path (str) – Full path to an ESX host. Format: /{datacenter folder}/{datacenter name}/host/{host name}. e.g: /Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Host

class DeploymentSizeDestinationAppliance(ova_location=None, ova_location_ssl_verify=None, ova_location_ssl_thumbprint=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Spec to describe the new appliance.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • ova_location (str or None) – The location of the ova file. Not required.

  • ova_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – A flag to indicate whether the ssl verification is required. If ovaLocationSslThumbprint is provided, this field can be omitted If None, defaults to True

  • ova_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of ssl verification. If provided, ssl_verify can be omitted or set to true. If omitted, ssl_verify must be false. If omitted and ssl_verify is true, an error will occur. If ova_location_ssl_verify is False, this field can be omitted

class MigrateDeploymentSizeRequest(destination_appliance=None, source_vc_windows=None, existing_migration_assistant=None, start_migration_assistant=None, source_vum_location=None, source_vum=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

The request for recommending migrate deployment size.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • destination_appliance (Recommendation.DeploymentSizeDestinationAppliance) – Spec to describe the new appliance.

  • source_vc_windows (SourceVcWindows) – Spec to describe the existing Windows vCenter server to migrate.

  • existing_migration_assistant (ExistingMigrationAssistant or None) – Spec to describe the attributes of a running Migration Assistant on the Windows vCenter server. Only applicable when migration assistant is already running on the source appliance

  • start_migration_assistant (MigrationAssistant or None) – Spec to automate the invocation of Migration Assistant. Automatic invocation works only if the source Windows installation is running as a virtual machine. Only applicable when migration assistant is not running on the source appliance.

  • source_vum_location (Connection or None) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

  • source_vum (SourceVum or None) – This section describes the source vSphere Update Manager (VUM) which you want to upgrade. Not applicable for appliance not having source vSphere Update Manager

class UpgradeDeploymentSizeRequest(destination_appliance=None, source_location=None, source_appliance=None, source_vum=None, source_vum_location=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Tip

Parameters

  • destination_appliance (Recommendation.DeploymentSizeDestinationAppliance) – Spec to describe the new appliance

  • source_location (Connection) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

  • source_appliance (UpgradeSourceAppliance) – Spec to describe the existing appliance to upgrade.

  • source_vum (SourceVum or None) – This section describes the source vSphere Update Manager (VUM) which you want to upgrade. Not applicable for appliance not having source vSphere Update Manager

  • source_vum_location (Connection or None) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.Result(info=None, warnings=None, errors=None)¶

Parameters

  • info (list of Notification or None) – Info notification messages reported. Only set if an info was reported by the task.

  • warnings (list of Notification or None) – Warning notification messages reported. Only set if an warning was reported by the task.

  • errors (list of Notification or None) – Error notification messages reported. Only set if an error was reported by the task.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.SourceVcWindows(hostname=None, username=None, password=None, ssl_verify=None, ssl_thumbprint=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Configuration of the source Windows VC.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • hostname (str) – The IP address or FQDN of the source Windows vCenter server to migrate. If an FQDN is provided, it must be resolvable from the machine that is running the installer.

  • username (str) – Single Sign-On administrator user on the source Windows vCenter server. For example, administrator\@vsphere.local. Important: The user must be administrator\@your_domain_name.

  • password (str) – The password of the Single Sign-On administrator on the source Windows vCenter server.

  • ssl_verify (bool or None) –

  • ssl_thumbprint (str or None) –

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.SourceVum(hostname=None, os_username=None, os_password=None, export_dir=None, port=None, start_migration_assistant=None, existing_migration_assistant=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Configuration of the source VUM.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • hostname (str) – IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the vSphere Update Manager host. If an FQDN is provided, it has to be resolvable from the machine that is running the installer.

  • os_username (str) – Administrator username for the source vSphere Update Manager Windows operating system.

  • os_password (str) – Administrator user password for the source vSphere Update Manager Windows operating system.

  • export_dir (str or None) – Directory to export source configuration and data. If None, defaults to for mac/lin: /var/tmp, for windows: %TEMP%

  • port (long or None) – The port of the source vum. default to be 9123

  • start_migration_assistant (SourceVumMigrationAssistant or None) – Configuration of migration assistant to be deployed to the vSphere Upgrade Manager. Mutually exclusive between start migration assistant and existing migration assistant.

  • existing_migration_assistant (ExistingMigrationAssistant or None) – Configuration of migration assistant that are already running on the vSphere Upgrade Manager.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.SourceVumMigrationAssistant(installer_location=None, installer_location_ssl_verify=None, installer_location_ssl_thumbprint=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Configuration of migration assistant to be deployed to the vSphere Upgrade Manager.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • installer_location (str or None) – Location of the installer of migration assistant to be uploaded to the source vSphere Update Manager. Mutually exclusive between start migration assistant and existing migration assistant.

  • installer_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – A flag to indicate whether to verify ssl connection of the location of the installer of migration assistant. when SSL thumbprint is provided, SSL verify is not required.

  • installer_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of the location of the installer of migration assistant. if ssl verify is set to False, thumbprint is not required.

Parameters

To use new values of the enumerated type in communication with a server that supports the newer version of the API, you instantiate this class. See enumerated type description page.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.SubTaskInfo(progress=None, last_updated_time=None, result=None, external_tools=None, description=None, service=None, operation=None, parent=None, target=None, status=None, cancelable=None, error=None, start_time=None, end_time=None, user=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Container that contains the status information about a single task.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • progress (com.vmware.cis.task_client.Progress) – The progress info of this deployment task.

  • last_updated_time (datetime.datetime) – The time that the last update is registered.

  • result (Result or None) – Result of the task. This attribute will be None if result is not available at the current step of the task.

  • external_tools (list of ExternalTool) – External tools used for the deployment.

  • description (com.vmware.vapi.std_client.LocalizableMessage) – Description of the operation associated with the task.

  • service (str) – Identifier of the service containing the operation. When clients pass a value of this class as a parameter, the attribute must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.service. When methods return a value of this class as a return value, the attribute will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.service.

  • operation (str) – Identifier of the operation associated with the task. When clients pass a value of this class as a parameter, the attribute must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.operation. When methods return a value of this class as a return value, the attribute will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.operation.

  • parent (str or None) – Parent of the current task. When clients pass a value of this class as a parameter, the attribute must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.task. When methods return a value of this class as a return value, the attribute will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.task. This attribute will be None if the task has no parent.

  • target (com.vmware.vapi.std_client.DynamicID or None) – Identifier of the target created by the operation or an existing one the operation performed on. This attribute will be None if the operation has no target or multiple targets.

  • status (com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status) – Status of the operation associated with the task.

  • cancelable (bool) – Flag to indicate whether or not the operation can be cancelled. The value may change as the operation progresses.

  • error (Exception or None) – Description of the error if the operation status is “FAILED”. If None the description of why the operation failed will be included in the result of the operation (see com.vmware.cis.task_client.Info.result).

  • start_time (datetime.datetime) – Time when the operation is started. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of status is one of com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.RUNNING, com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.BLOCKED, com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.SUCCEEDED, or com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.FAILED.

  • end_time (datetime.datetime) – Time when the operation is completed. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of status is one of com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.SUCCEEDED or com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.FAILED.

  • user (str or None) – Name of the user who performed the operation. This attribute will be None if the operation is performed by the system.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.TaskInfo(metadata_file=None, state=None, progress=None, last_updated_time=None, subtask_order=None, subtasks=None, appliance_info=None, result=None, additional_info=None, description=None, service=None, operation=None, parent=None, target=None, status=None, cancelable=None, error=None, start_time=None, end_time=None, user=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

The container that contains the status information of a deployment.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • metadata_file (str) – The path of the metadata file.

  • state (str or None) – The state of appliance being deployed. May not have any state information.

  • progress (com.vmware.cis.task_client.Progress) – The total progress of the deployment operation. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of #status is one of com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.RUNNING, com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.FAILED, com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.SUCCEEDED, or com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.BLOCKED.

  • last_updated_time (datetime.datetime) – The time that the last update is registered.

  • subtask_order (list of list of str or None) – The ordered list of subtasks for this deployment operation. Only set when the appliance state is RUNNING_IN_PROGRESS, FAILED, CANCELLED and SUCCEEDED.

  • subtasks ((dict of str and SubTaskInfo) or None) – The map of the deployment subtasks and their status information. Only set when the appliance state is RUNNING_IN_PROGRESS, FAILED, CANCELLED and SUCCEEDED.

  • appliance_info (DeploymentInfo or None) – Information about the appliance deployed. Such information may not be available for requests that are not for deployment (validation/recommendation).

  • result (DataValue or None) – The result of validation or recommendation requests. Not applicable for precheck/deployment operation.

  • additional_info (str or None) – Additional information that a response may contain. Not all response will contain additional information.

  • description (com.vmware.vapi.std_client.LocalizableMessage) – Description of the operation associated with the task.

  • service (str) – Identifier of the service containing the operation. When clients pass a value of this class as a parameter, the attribute must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.service. When methods return a value of this class as a return value, the attribute will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.service.

  • operation (str) – Identifier of the operation associated with the task. When clients pass a value of this class as a parameter, the attribute must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.operation. When methods return a value of this class as a return value, the attribute will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vapi.operation.

  • parent (str or None) – Parent of the current task. When clients pass a value of this class as a parameter, the attribute must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.task. When methods return a value of this class as a return value, the attribute will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.task. This attribute will be None if the task has no parent.

  • target (com.vmware.vapi.std_client.DynamicID or None) – Identifier of the target created by the operation or an existing one the operation performed on. This attribute will be None if the operation has no target or multiple targets.

  • status (com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status) – Status of the operation associated with the task.

  • cancelable (bool) – Flag to indicate whether or not the operation can be cancelled. The value may change as the operation progresses.

  • error (Exception or None) – Description of the error if the operation status is “FAILED”. If None the description of why the operation failed will be included in the result of the operation (see com.vmware.cis.task_client.Info.result).

  • start_time (datetime.datetime) – Time when the operation is started. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of status is one of com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.RUNNING, com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.BLOCKED, com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.SUCCEEDED, or com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.FAILED.

  • end_time (datetime.datetime) – Time when the operation is completed. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of status is one of com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.SUCCEEDED or com.vmware.cis.task_client.Status.FAILED.

  • user (str or None) – Name of the user who performed the operation. This attribute will be None if the operation is performed by the system.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.TemporaryNetwork(ip_family=None, mode=None, ip=None, dns_servers=None, prefix=None, gateway=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Configuration of the temporary network which is used during upgrade/migrate.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • ip_family (TemporaryNetwork.IpType or None) – Network IP address family. If None, defaults to IPV4

  • mode (TemporaryNetwork.NetworkMode) – Network mode.

  • ip (str) – Network IP address. Required for static mode only. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of mode is TemporaryNetwork.NetworkMode.STATIC.

  • dns_servers (list of str) – A comma-separated list of IP addresses of DNS servers. A JSON array such as [“1.2.3.4”, “127.0.0.1”]. Required for static mode only. DNS servers must be reachable from the machine that runs CLI installer This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of mode is TemporaryNetwork.NetworkMode.STATIC.

  • prefix (long) – Network prefix length. Required for static mode only. Remove if the mode is “dhcp”. This is the number of bits set in the subnet mask; for instance, if the subnet mask is 255.255.255.0, there are 24 bits in the binary version of the subnet mask, so the prefix length is 24. If used, the values must be in the inclusive range of 0 to 32 for IPv4 and 0 to 128 for IPv6. Required for static mode only. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of mode is TemporaryNetwork.NetworkMode.STATIC.

  • gateway (str) – Gateway of the network. Required for static mode only. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of mode is TemporaryNetwork.NetworkMode.STATIC.

class IpType(string)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.enum.Enum

Network IP address family.

Note

This class represents an enumerated type in the interface language definition. The class contains class attributes which represent the values in the current version of the enumerated type. class NetworkMode(string)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.enum.Enum

Network mode.

Note

This class represents an enumerated type in the interface language definition. The class contains class attributes which represent the values in the current version of the enumerated type. Newer versions of the enumerated type may contain new values. To use new values of the enumerated type in communication with a server that supports the newer version of the API, you instantiate this class. See enumerated type description page.

Parameters

string (str) – String value for the NetworkMode instance.

DHCP = NetworkMode(string='DHCP')¶

DHCP mode.

STATIC = NetworkMode(string='STATIC')¶

Static IP mode.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.Time(ntp_servers=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

NTP setting of the appliance to be deployed.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

ntp_servers (list of str or None) – To configure NTP time synchronization for the appliance, set the value to a comma - separated list of host names or IP addresses of Network Time Protocol(NTP) servers. If “ntp_servers” is not provided, the appliance clock will be synced to the ESX. For example: [“time.nist.gov”]. Times tool sync will be enabled when ntp server is not provided. If None, defaults to []

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.Upgrade(config)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.stub.VapiInterface

The service to upgrade an existing appliance to Embedded VCSA, PSC, and Management VCSA.

Parameters

config (vmware.vapi.bindings.stub.StubConfiguration) – Configuration to be used for creating the stub.

class Spec(destination_location=None, destination_appliance=None, source_location=None, source_appliance=None, source_vum=None, source_vum_location=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Spec to describe the configuration parameters that are required for upgrade of a vCenter Server Appliance.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • destination_location (DestinationLocation) – This subsection describes the ESX or VC on which to deploy the appliance.

  • destination_appliance (Upgrade.UpgradeDestinationAppliance) – Spec to describe the new appliance

  • source_location (Connection) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

  • source_appliance (UpgradeSourceAppliance) – Spec to describe the existing appliance to upgrade.

  • source_vum (SourceVum or None) – This section describes the source vSphere Update Manager (VUM) which you want to upgrade. Not applicable for appliance not having source vSphere Update Manager

  • source_vum_location (Connection or None) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

class UpgradeDestinationAppliance(appliance_name=None, appliance_type=None, appliance_size=None, appliance_disk_size=None, thin_disk_mode=None, ova_location=None, ova_location_ssl_verify=None, ova_location_ssl_thumbprint=None, ovftool_location=None, ovftool_location_ssl_verify=None, ovftool_location_ssl_thumbprint=None, services=None, temporary_network=None, history=None, ovftool_arguments=None, vcsa_embedded=None, psc=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Spec to describe the new appliance

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • appliance_name (str) – The name of the appliance to deploy.

  • appliance_type (ApplianceType) – The type of appliance to deploy.

  • appliance_size (ApplianceSize or None) – A size descriptor based on the number of virtual machines which will be managed by the new vCenter appliance. If None, defaults to SMALL

  • appliance_disk_size (StorageSize or None) – The disk size of the new vCenter appliance. If None, defaults to REGULAR

  • thin_disk_mode (bool) – Whether to deploy the appliance with thin mode virtual disks.

  • ova_location (str) – The location of the OVA file.

  • ova_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – A flag to indicate whether the ssl verification is required. If ovaLocationSslThumbprint is provided, this field can be omitted If None, defaults to True

  • ova_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of ssl verification. If provided, ssl_verify can be omitted or set to true. If omitted, ssl_verify must be false. If omitted and ssl_verify is true, an error will occur. If ova_location_ssl_verify is False, this field can be omitted

  • ovftool_location (str) – The location of the OVF Tool.

  • ovftool_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – Flag to indicate whether or not to verify the SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location. Default to be True.

  • ovftool_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location to be verified. When ovftoolLocationSslVerify is set to False, this field can be omitted.

  • services (UpgradeDestinationApplianceService) – Spec to configure vCenter server services.

  • temporary_network (TemporaryNetwork) – The network settings of the appliance to be deployed.

  • history (History or None) – History data to be included in the upgrade and migrate Default value will be applied when absent

  • ovftool_arguments ((dict of str and str) or None) – The OVF Tool arguments to be included. Not required when no OVF Tool argument to pass through

  • vcsa_embedded (CeipOnlySso) – Spec used to configure an embedded vCenter Server. This field describes how the embedded vCenter Server appliance should be configured. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of applianceType is ApplianceType.VCSA_EMBEDDED.

  • psc (CeipOnlySso) – Spec used to configure a Platform Services Controller. This section describes how the Platform Services Controller appliance should be configured. If unset, either vcsaEmbedded or #vcsaExternal must be provided. This attribute is optional and it is only relevant when the value of applianceType is ApplianceType.PSC.

check_task(spec, options=None)¶

Performs a precheck for the given specification. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} with the task-id in the response of this call.

Parameters

  • spec (Upgrade.Spec) – The specification of the deployment.

  • options (DeploymentOption or None) – The deployment precheck options.

Raise

com.vmware.vapi.std.errors_client.InvalidArgument If the given spec and/or option contains error.

start_task(spec)¶

Deploys the appliance for the given specification. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} with the task-id in the response of this call.

Parameters

spec (Upgrade.Spec) – The specification of the deployment.

Raise

com.vmware.vapi.std.errors_client.InvalidArgument If the given specification contains error.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.UpgradeDestinationApplianceService(ssh=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Configurable services of destination appliance for upgrade/migrate operation.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

ssh (Ssh) – Whether to enable SSH on the vCenter Appliance.

class com.vmware.vcenter.lcm_client.UpgradeSourceAppliance(hostname=None, sso_admin_username=None, sso_admin_password=None, root_password=None, https_port=None, ssl_verify=None, ssl_thumbprint=None, export_dir=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Configuration of the source appliance to be upgraded/migrated.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • hostname (str) – The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the vCenter Server instance. If an FQDN is provided, it has to be resolvable from the machine that is running the installer.

  • sso_admin_username (str) – vCenter Single Sign-On administrator user name of the source appliance.

  • sso_admin_password (str) – vCenter Single Sign-On administrator password of the source appliance.

  • root_password (str) – Password of the operating system root user of the appliance.

  • https_port (long or None) – The HTTPS port number to connect to the source appliance. If None, defaults to 443

  • ssl_verify (bool or None) –

  • ssl_thumbprint (str or None) –

  • export_dir (str or None) – Export directory of the source appliance. Default to be “/var/tmp/”.

  • vcenter (Validation.ApplianceNameVc or None) – This subsection describes the vCenter on which to deploy the appliance. Mutual exclusive between esx and vcenter

class ApplianceNameRequest(destination_location=None, destination_appliance=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Data container that contains the information needed to validate appliance name.

Tip

  • destination_appliance (Validation.ApplianceNameDestinationAppliance) – Spec to describe the new appliance.

class ApplianceNameVc(connection=None, inventory=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

This subsection describes the vCenter on which to deploy the appliance.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • connection (Connection) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

  • inventory (Validation.ApplianceNameVcInventory) – All names are case-sensitive. you can install the appliance to one of the following destinations: 1. A resource pool in a cluster, use ‘cluster_path’. 2. A specific ESX host in a cluster, use ‘host_path’. 3. A resource pool in a specific ESX host being managed by the current vCenter, use ‘resource_pool_path’. You must always provide the ‘network_name’ key. To install a new appliance to a specific ESX host in a cluster, provide the ‘host_path’ key, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘host_path’: ‘/MyDataCenter/host/MyCluster/10.20.30.40’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To install a new appliance to a specific resource pool, provide the ‘resource_pool_path’, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘resource_pool_path’: ‘/Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster/Resources/Your Resource Pool’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To place a new appliance to a virtual machine Folder, provide the ‘vm_folder_path’, e.g. ‘vm_folder_path’: ‘VM Folder 0/VM Folder1’.

class ApplianceNameVcInventory(vm_folder_path=None, resource_pool_path=None, cluster_path=None, host_path=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

All names are case-sensitive. you can install the appliance to one of the following destinations: 1. A resource pool in a cluster, use ‘cluster_path’. 2. A specific ESX host in a cluster, use ‘host_path’. 3. A resource pool in a specific ESX host being managed by the current vCenter, use ‘resource_pool_path’. You must always provide the ‘network_name’ key. To install a new appliance to a specific ESX host in a cluster, provide the ‘host_path’ key, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘host_path’: ‘/MyDataCenter/host/MyCluster/10.20.30.40’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To install a new appliance to a specific resource pool, provide the ‘resource_pool_path’, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘resource_pool_path’: ‘/Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster/Resources/Your Resource Pool’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To place a new appliance to a virtual machine Folder, provide the ‘vm_folder_path’, e.g. ‘vm_folder_path’: ‘VM Folder 0/VM Folder1’.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • vm_folder_path (str or None) –

  • resource_pool_path (str or None) – Full path to resource pool. Format: /{datacenter folder}/{datacenter name}/host/{host name}/{cluster_name}/Resources/{resource pool}. e.g: /Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster/Resources/Your Resource Pool Mutually exclusive between #resource_pool_path, #cluster_path, and #host_path

  • cluster_path (str or None) – Full path to the cluster. Format: /{datacenter folder}/{datacenter name}/host/{cluster_name}. e.g: /Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster Mutually exclusive between #resource_pool_path, #cluster_path, and #host_path

  • host_path (str or None) – Full path to an ESX host. Format: /{datacenter folder}/{datacenter name}/host/{host name}. e.g: /Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Host Mutually exclusive between #resource_pool_path, #cluster_path, and #host_path

  • inventory (VcInventory or None) – All names are case-sensitive. you can install the appliance to one of the following destinations: 1. A resource pool in a cluster, use ‘cluster_path’. 2. A specific ESX host in a cluster, use ‘host_path’. 3. A resource pool in a specific ESX host being managed by the current vCenter, use ‘resource_pool_path’. You must always provide the ‘network_name’ key. To install a new appliance to a specific ESX host in a cluster, provide the ‘host_path’ key, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘host_path’: ‘/MyDataCenter/host/MyCluster/10.20.30.40’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To install a new appliance to a specific resource pool, provide the ‘resource_pool_path’, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘resource_pool_path’: ‘/Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster/Resources/Your Resource Pool’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To place a new appliance to a virtual machine Folder, provide the ‘vm_folder_path’, e.g. ‘vm_folder_path’: ‘VM Folder 0/VM Folder1’.

class HostConfigDestinationAppliance(appliance_name=None, appliance_type=None, appliance_size=None, appliance_disk_size=None, thin_disk_mode=None, ova_location=None, ova_location_ssl_verify=None, ova_location_ssl_thumbprint=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Data container for appliance name information used in validation of appliance name request.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • appliance_name (str) – The name of the appliance to deploy.

  • appliance_type (ApplianceType) – The type of appliance to deploy.

  • appliance_size (ApplianceSize or None) – A size descriptor based on the number of virtual machines which will be managed by the new vCenter appliance. If None, defaults to SMALL

  • appliance_disk_size (StorageSize or None) – The disk size of the new vCenter appliance. If None, defaults to REGULAR

  • thin_disk_mode (bool) – Whether to deploy the appliance with thin mode virtual disks.

  • ova_location (str or None) – The location of the ova file. Not required.

  • ova_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – A flag to indicate whether the ssl verification is required. If ovaLocationSslThumbprint is provided, this field can be omitted If None, defaults to True

  • ova_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of ssl verification. If provided, ssl_verify can be omitted or set to true. If omitted, ssl_verify must be false. If omitted and ssl_verify is true, an error will occur. If ova_location_ssl_verify is False, this field can be omitted

  • vcenter (Validation.HostConfigVc or None) – This subsection describes the vCenter on which to deploy the appliance. Mutual exclusive between esx and vcenter

class HostConfigEsx(connection=None, inventory=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

class HostConfigEsxInventory(datastore_name=None, resource_pool_path=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

The configuration of ESX inventory.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • datastore_name (str) – The datastore on which to store the files of the appliance. This value has to be either a specific datastore name, or a specific datastore in a datastore cluster. The datastore must be accessible from the ESX host and must have at least 25 GB of free space. Otherwise, the new appliance might not power on.

  • resource_pool_path (str or None) – The path to the resource pool on the ESX host in which the appliance will be deployed. Not applicable when not in resource pool

  • destination_appliance (Validation.HostConfigDestinationAppliance) – Spec to describe the new appliance.

class HostConfigVc(connection=None, inventory=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

This subsection describes the vCenter on which to deploy the appliance.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • connection (Connection) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

  • inventory (Validation.HostConfigVcInventory) – All names are case-sensitive. you can install the appliance to one of the following destinations: 1. A resource pool in a cluster, use ‘cluster_path’. 2. A specific ESX host in a cluster, use ‘host_path’. 3. A resource pool in a specific ESX host being managed by the current vCenter, use ‘resource_pool_path’. You must always provide the ‘network_name’ key. To install a new appliance to a specific ESX host in a cluster, provide the ‘host_path’ key, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘host_path’: ‘/MyDataCenter/host/MyCluster/10.20.30.40’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To install a new appliance to a specific resource pool, provide the ‘resource_pool_path’, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘resource_pool_path’: ‘/Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster/Resources/Your Resource Pool’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To place a new appliance to a virtual machine Folder, provide the ‘vm_folder_path’, e.g. ‘vm_folder_path’: ‘VM Folder 0/VM Folder1’.

class HostConfigVcInventory(vm_folder_path=None, resource_pool_path=None, cluster_path=None, host_path=None, datastore_name=None, datastore_cluster_name=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

All names are case-sensitive. you can install the appliance to one of the following destinations: 1. A resource pool in a cluster, use ‘cluster_path’. 2. A specific ESX host in a cluster, use ‘host_path’. 3. A resource pool in a specific ESX host being managed by the current vCenter, use ‘resource_pool_path’. You must always provide the ‘network_name’ key. To install a new appliance to a specific ESX host in a cluster, provide the ‘host_path’ key, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘host_path’: ‘/MyDataCenter/host/MyCluster/10.20.30.40’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To install a new appliance to a specific resource pool, provide the ‘resource_pool_path’, and the ‘datastore_name’, e.g. ‘resource_pool_path’: ‘/Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster/Resources/Your Resource Pool’, ‘datastore_name’: ‘Your Datastore’. To place a new appliance to a virtual machine Folder, provide the ‘vm_folder_path’, e.g. ‘vm_folder_path’: ‘VM Folder 0/VM Folder1’.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • vm_folder_path (str or None) – Path of the VM folder. VM folder must be visible by the Data Center of the compute resourceFormat:{vm_folder1}/{vm_folder2}e.g.:’VM Folder 0/VM Folder1’. Mutually exclusive between #resource_pool_path, #cluster_path, and #host_path

  • resource_pool_path (str or None) – Full path to resource pool. Format: /{datacenter folder}/{datacenter name}/host/{host name}/{cluster_name}/Resources/{resource pool}. e.g: /Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster/Resources/Your Resource Pool Mutually exclusive between #resource_pool_path, #cluster_path, and #host_path

  • cluster_path (str or None) – Full path to the cluster. Format: /{datacenter folder}/{datacenter name}/host/{cluster_name}. e.g: /Your Datacenter Folder/Your Datacenter/host/Your Cluster Mutually exclusive between #resource_pool_path, #cluster_path, and #host_path

  • host_path (str or None) –

  • datastore_name (str or None) – The datastore on which to store the files of the appliance. This value has to be either a specific datastore name, or a specific datastore in a datastore cluster. The datastore must be accessible from the ESX host and must have at least 25 GB of free space. Otherwise, the new appliance might not power on. Mutually exclusive between #datastore_name and #datastore_cluster_name

  • datastore_cluster_name (str or None) – The datastore cluster on which to store the files of the appliance. Mutually exclusive between #datastore_name and #datastore_cluster_name

class MigrateSourceApplianceRequest(destination_appliance=None, source_vc_windows=None, existing_migration_assistant=None, start_migration_assistant=None, source_vum_location=None, source_vum=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

This subsection describes the ESX or VC on which to deploy the appliance.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

  • destination_appliance (Recommendation.DeploymentSizeDestinationAppliance) – Spec to describe the new appliance.

  • source_vc_windows (SourceVcWindows) – Spec to describe the existing Windows vCenter server to migrate.

  • existing_migration_assistant (ExistingMigrationAssistant or None) – Spec to describe the attributes of a running Migration Assistant on the Windows vCenter server. Only applicable when migration assistant is already running on the source appliance

  • start_migration_assistant (MigrationAssistant or None) – Spec to automate the invocation of Migration Assistant. Automatic invocation works only if the source Windows installation is running as a virtual machine. Only applicable when migration assistant is not running on the source appliance.

  • source_vum_location (Connection or None) – The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

  • source_vum (SourceVum or None) – This section describes the source vSphere Update Manager (VUM) which you want to upgrade. Not applicable for appliance not having source vSphere Update Manager

class OsPasswordDestinationAppliance(root_password=None)¶

Bases: vmware.vapi.bindings.struct.VapiStruct

Spec to describe the new appliance.

Tip

The arguments are used to initialize data attributes with the same names.

Parameters

root_password (str) – Password must conform to the following requirements: 1. At least 8 characters. 2. No more than 20 characters. 3. At least 1 uppercase character. 4. At least 1 lowercase character. 5. At least 1 number. 6. At least 1 special character (e.g., ‘!’, ‘(‘, ‘\@’, etc.). 7. Only visible A-Z, a-z, 0-9 and punctuation (spaces are not allowed)

class OsPasswordRequest(destination_appliance=None)¶

class UpgradeSourceApplianceDestinationAppliance(ova_location=None, ova_location_ssl_verify=None, ova_location_ssl_thumbprint=None)¶

Parameters

  • ova_location (str or None) – The location of the ova file. Not required.

  • ova_location_ssl_verify (bool or None) – A flag to indicate whether the ssl verification is required. If ovaLocationSslThumbprint is provided, this field can be omitted If None, defaults to True

  • ova_location_ssl_thumbprint (str or None) – SSL thumbprint of ssl verification. If provided, ssl_verify can be omitted or set to true. If omitted, ssl_verify must be false. If omitted and ssl_verify is true, an error will occur. If ova_location_ssl_verify is False, this field can be omitted

check_host_config_task(spec)¶

Validate the host configuration.

  1. 1. Return False if the provided appliance type, appliance size, and disk size combination is not valid.

  2. 2. Return False if the provided deployment path does not have sufficient memory allocated.

  3. 3. Return False if the provided deployment path does not have sufficient cpu allocated.

  4. 3. Return False if the provided deployment path does not have sufficient datastore space.

Parameters

spec (Validation.HostConfigRequest) – The configuration needed to validate host configuration.
